Package org.svvrl.goal.core.layout

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.layout.Graph
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
This class is used for graphic layout. To lay out an automaton, a corresponding Graph object will be created first, then apply a layout algorithm on the graph, and finally move states of the automaton based on the nodes of the graph.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • removeDirectedEdge

      public boolean removeDirectedEdge​(Edge e)
      Removes a directed edge from this graph. The undirected view will also be updated accordingly.
      Parameters:
      e - an edge to be removed from this graph
      Returns:
      true if this graph contained e

    • removeDirectedEdge

      public boolean removeDirectedEdge​(Node f, Node t)
      Removes the directed edge from a specified source node to a specified destination node from this graph. The undirected view will also be updated accordingly.
      Parameters:
      f - the source node of the edge to be removed
      t - the destination node of the edge to be removed
      Returns:
      true if this graph contained an edge from node f to node t

    • fromAutomaton

      public static Graph fromAutomaton​(Automaton aut)
      Creates a graph object from an automaton. It is guaranteed that the i-th node in #getNodes() corresponds to the i-th state in org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Automaton#getStates().
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton
      Returns:
      the graph of aut
